author: Nicholas Harris, Genesis Platform Inc.

baseline_case.description: Standard industry approach: monolithic ceramic electrolyte without architected features

genesis_case.description: Topology-optimized porous architecture with graded stiffness field

improvement_metrics.note_deflection: 12.7x from continuous gradient (115.6/9.1 nm), 7.6x from pixelated gradient (102.8/13.6 nm). Range depends on stiffness field configuration.
improvement_metrics.note_suppression: KEY METRIC: 7.6-12.7x improvement depending on stiffness field configuration. Enhanced validation (200x200) shows 452x penetration suppression.

physics_basis.governing_equation: When W_elastic > F*η/Ω, dendrite growth is thermodynamically forbidden
physics_basis.reference: Monroe & Newman (2005), J. Electrochem. Soc. 152(2), A396-A404

critical_current_density.note: Maximum current density before dendrite initiation in Genesis architecture

data_provenance.computational_method: Finite Difference, Allen-Cahn + Cahn-Hilliard coupled equations
data_provenance.verification_method: Grid convergence study, energy conservation check

public_disclosure_note: This is a summary of validated simulation results. Full simulation code and raw data available in private data room under NDA.
